intro: Romulea arenaria, commonly known as the sand romulea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Iridaceae family, which includes many ornamental and economically important plants. The plant produces small, delicate flowers in shades of yellow and orange, typically blooming in late summer. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its unique appearance and drought tolerance make it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
